lexUnit.name: mass.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large number of people or objects gathered together.

sentence.text: The codename was chosen because rhyolite is a volcanic rock containing colourful pieces of quartz set in a mass of crystals .
Without clumsy pipes and masks , it would be delightful to blow a big mass of oxygen foam from the DREADCO dispenser , and bury one 's face in it .
The countryside became more deserted , farmsteads and villages more sparse as they approached the green mass of trees on the far horizon which Corbett knew must be the great Forest of Ettrick .
Ideal for small gardens , the weeping cotoneaster hybridus Pendulus has a striking leaf and outline , and produces a mass of brilliant red fruit .
When conditions are very favourable a mass of trailing stems are produced .
Angalo had said he thought the inside of a plane would be a mass of wires and pipes .
Emily sat in her father 's study , staring at the mass of figures that danced before her eyes .
Also with the advancing columns were a mass of Croatian civilian refugees , equally desperate to enter Austria to escape from Tito 's forces .
Tallboy examined the mass of weights and balls .
But then streets disappeared altogether and there was just a mass of houses running into one another with the occasional alleyway between them .
A mass of footage whizzed across the screens .
Though touching briefly on all three , the encyclopedic John Grant mainly offers a pleasant novelty -- a mass of numerically arranged information .
The manor is built of ` Kelloway 's Rock " , a peculiar oolitic limestone containing masses of fossils , which was quarried nearby .
The hull contained a mass of dissimilar metals : steel , cast and malleable iron , brass. bronze and lead .
That 's just if the border guards ask you for such a mass of detail .
Lavishly illustrated with some stunning photographs this book does not purport to be a detailed history of the type , nor to include a mass of facts and figures about the aircraft .
You now have to turn a mass of information into a coherent argument .

No doubt computers will be utilized to manage and track the inevitable masses of information and to provide comparative fitness testing data on what could be a pool of more than 100 players in the three categories .
This mass of material can be grouped into a number of key areas .
The masses of materials used at each stage must equal the masses of material produced .
` It is manifestly unjust that a privileged few should continue to accumulate excess goods , squandering available resources while masses of people are living in conditions of misery .
